result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan L Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, assessments and victim.witness surcharges, DNA surcharges. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Seek and maintain full-time employment.
Obtain HSED or GED.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.

Do not possess/use illegal substances.
No contact with DJP, dob 7-3-1999.
No unsupervised contact with persons under the age of 17 years.

Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Sex offender assessment and treatment.
Register as a sex offender.
Mental Health assessment and treatment.
Cognitive intervention programming, if deemed appropriate.
Comply with all terms and conditions of supervision.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
AODA and other counseling needs to be determined, random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Work/school/counseling release privileges AFTER serving first 6 months

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan L Peterson

defendant.name: Peterson, Jordan L
defendant.address: W4380 Copper Lake Avenue, Irma, WI 54442

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING TRANSCRIPT Transcript (28 pages) commencing 07-10-2014 received and filed.  CH

Defendant Jordan L Peterson in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Jordan L Peterson in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 10.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by DJP; Demetrius P.; Gloria H.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 102 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 6 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 5 YEARS.  Conditions of probation include:
-Serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction with work/school/counseling release privileges AFTER serving first 6 months.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Sex offender assessment and treatment; 
-Register as a sex offender.
-Mental health assessment and treatment;
-Cognitive intervention programming, if deemed appropriate;
-Comply with all terms and conditions of supervision;
-Seek and maintain full-time employment.
-Obtain HSED or GED;
-Do not possess/use illegal substances;
-No contact with DJP, dob 7-3-1999.
-No unsupervised contact with persons under the age of 17 years;
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is remanded.  
Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Case transferred forthwith to Branch 38 for sentencing.
jad

Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 7-10-2014 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 10.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Jordan L Peterson in court with attorney Martin R Tanz.  Defendant Jordan L Peterson in custody.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNT 2:
State's motion to dismiss and read-in count 2 granted by the court.

Attorney Martin R Tanz in court, defendant Jordan L Peterson not in court, in custody.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 10.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Martin R Tanz in court, defendant Jordan L Peterson not in court, in custody.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 10.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jordan L Peterson in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Jordan L Peterson in custody. Jennifer Williams for Chris Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DJP dob 7/3/99

Defendant Jordan L Peterson in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Jordan L Peterson in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
